'''Jonathan "Manu" Bennett''' (born [[10 October]], [[1969]] in Rotorua, New Zealand) is an [[Australia|Australian]]-[[New Zealand]] actor who portrayed [[Azog]] through [[wikipedia:Motion-capture acting|performance-capture]] in the [[The Hobbit (film series)|''The Hobbit'' (film series)]]. At a young age, Bennet moved to Australia with his mother, a bikini model, and his father, a singer. He went on to attend Merewether High School<ref>Dan Proudman, "Newcastle-raised actor, Manu Bennett charged in Texas with assault", ''Newcastle Herald''. Australian Community Media, 20 September 2015</ref> and later returned to New Zealand to attend Te Aute College, where he played on the college rugby team. Bennett then quit rugby to study drama and dance and later moved to Los Angeles after receiving a scholarship to attend the Lee Strasberg Theatre Institute. Bennett has three children with his ex-wife<ref>Ricardo Simich, "[https://web.archive.org/web/20180226092134/http://spy.nzherald.co.nz/spy-news/spartacus-star-manu-bennett-confirms-split/ Spartacus star Manu Bennett confirms split]", ''The New Zealand Herald''. Retrieved 23 October 2024</ref> Karin Horen<ref>Kasia Jillings. "[https://web.archive.org/web/20160306022626/https://nz.lifestyle.yahoo.com/new-idea/star-watch/article/-/16971685/brave-mother-s-new-battle-i-ll-fight-the-cancer-again/ Brave Mother's new battle: I'll fight the cancer â€“ again]". ''Yahoo New Zealand Lifestyle,'' 2 May 2013, Retrieved 23 October 2024.</ref>.
